job_title: Director in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: The College (at the director level) allows for flexibility in regards to ones work schedule.
cons: Everything is secretive. Things that should be my responsibility, no one thinks to include me. However, I'm always asked to fix their mess-ups as well as handle items that do not fall within my purview. The salary has not kept up with the sharp increase in the cost of living. The people at top make great money. However, those below have to work additional jobs to survive. The College, then has the audacity, to mandate people seek permission to pursue a second job. If the College paid people more, then they would not need multiple streams of income.

review_title: Dedicated educators in a stunning setting
job_title: Professor in Saint Augustine, FL

cons: Small college that has limited administrative support.

job_title: Visiting Instructor in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: Great colleagues; outstanding students. Some freedom to design classes in your own way. Core classes have standardized texts and curriculum, but upper level are left to the instructor's discretion.
cons:
Pay. Higher ed is notorious for underpaying adjuncts, but Flagler is definitley on the low end. Advancement does not exist. No matter how long you've been there or what your qualifications are, you will not be given an opportunity for FT work unless you have a PhD. 

The college claims to be teaching-focused, but there seems to be little emphasis on the quality of instruction ability when hiring. Students report FT professors telling them to "Google it" instead of teaching skills needed for the course. Meanwhile, outcomes-focused adjuncts are left floating on the wind.

job_title: Visiting Instructor in Saint Augustine, FL

5-5 Teaching Load.
cons: Not with this school, but in general "Visiting" = lower pay then counterparts that do the same job and get a significantly more pay.

review_title: What a hoax of a college!
job_title: Assistant Professor in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: No pros, just a bad college.
cons:
What a paradise of a location, what a hoax of a college! Flagler College is like an academic black hole as once you get in you will never get out "alive." 
Basically, the management (program directors, chairs, deans, vice-presidents, etc.) of this College acts as a dictatorship as you have no saying as a professor. For example, you cannot pick your own schedule, and the chair says that this is because of being more "student-focused." However, I got most of my students telling me that they hate taking class at 8am, so I guess the schedule is not that "student-focused" in the end. Also, the college is run by students, but this is normal if you are in academia as Flagler College is a teaching school, and teaching schools need to listen a lot to their students because that's where the money comes from (it's a vicious circle). The management is chosen based on seniority, and lot of the management is bad. Either they do not have any inclination to managing people and/or they are just bad people. Please do not take a job offer from this hoax of a college if you have a choice!
